verses.verse: Then God<WH430> said<WH559> to Jacob,<WH3290> "Arise,<WH6965> go<WH5927> up to Bethel,<WH1008> and live<WH3427> there;<WH8033> and make<WH6213> an altar<WH4196> there<WH8033> to God,<WH410> who appeared<WH7200> to you when you fled<WH1272> from your brother<WH251> Esau.<WH6215>"

So Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to his household<WH1004> and to all<WH3605> who<WH834> were with him, "Put<WH5493> away<WH5493> the foreign<WH5236> gods<WH430> which<WH834> are among<WH8432> you, and purify<WH2891> yourselves, and change<WH2498> your garments;<WH8071>

and let us arise<WH6965> and go<WH5927> up to Bethel;<WH1008> and I will make<WH6213> an altar<WH4196> there<WH8033> to God,<WH410> who answered<WH6030> me in the day<WH3117> of my distress,<WH6869> and has been<WH1961> with me wherever<WH1870> <WH834> I have gone.<WH1980> "

So they gave<WH5414> to Jacob<WH3290> all<WH3605> the foreign<WH5236> gods<WH430> which<WH834> they had,<WH3027> and the rings<WH5141> which<WH834> were in their ears;<WH241> and Jacob<WH3290> hid<WH2934> them under<WH8478> the oak<WH424> which<WH834> was near<WH5973> Shechem.<WH7927>
As they journeyed,<WH5265> there was a great<WH430> terror<WH2847> upon the cities<WH5892> which<WH834> were around<WH5439> them, and they did not pursue<WH7291> the sons<WH1121> of Jacob.<WH3290>
So Jacob<WH3290> came<WH935> to Luz<WH3870> (that is, Bethel<WH1008>), which<WH834> is in the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> he and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> who<WH834> were with him.

And he built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> there,<WH8033> and called<WH7121> the place<WH4725> El-bethel, because<WH3588> there<WH8033> God<WH430> had revealed<WH1540> Himself to him, when he fled<WH1272> from his brother.<WH251>
Now Deborah,<WH1683> Rebekah's nurse,<WH3243> died,<WH4191> and she was buried<WH6912> below<WH4480> <WH8478> Bethel<WH1008> under<WH8478> the oak;<WH437> it was named<WH7121> <WH8034> Allon-bacuth.
Then God<WH430> appeared<WH7200> to Jacob<WH3290> again<WH5750> when he came<WH935> from Paddan-aram, and He blessed<WH1288> him.

And God<WH430> said<WH559> to him, "Your name<WH8034> is Jacob;<WH3290> You shall no<WH3808> longer<WH5750> be called<WH7121> Jacob,<WH3290> But Israel<WH3478> shall be your name.<WH8034>" Thus He called<WH7121> him Israel.<WH3478>

God<WH430> also said<WH559> to him, "I am God<WH410> Almighty;<WH7706> Be fruitful<WH6509> and multiply;<WH7235> A nation<WH1471> and a company<WH6951> of nations<WH1471> shall come<WH1961> from you, And kings<WH4428> shall come<WH3318> forth<WH3318> from you.
"And the land<WH776> which<WH834> I gave<WH5414> to Abraham<WH85> and Isaac,<WH3327> I will give<WH5414> it to you, And I will give<WH5414> the land<WH776> to your descendants<WH2233> after you."
Then God<WH430> went<WH5927> up from him in the place<WH4725> where<WH834> He had spoken<WH1696> with him.

And Jacob<WH3290> set<WH5324> up a pillar<WH4676> in the place<WH4725> where<WH834> He had spoken<WH1696> with him, a pillar<WH4676> of stone,<WH68> and he poured<WH5258> out a libation<WH5262> on it; he also poured<WH3332> oil<WH8081> on it.
So Jacob<WH3290> named<WH7121> <WH8034> the place<WH4725> where<WH834> <WH8033> God<WH430> had spoken<WH1696> with him, Bethel.<WH1008>

Then they journeyed<WH5265> from Bethel;<WH1008> and when there was still<WH5750> some<WH3530> distance<WH3530> <WH776> to go<WH935> to Ephrath,<WH672> Rachel<WH7354> began to give<WH3205> birth<WH3205> and she suffered<WH7185> severe<WH7185> labor.<WH3205>
And it came<WH1961> about when she was in severe<WH7185> labor<WH3205> that the midwife<WH3205> said<WH559> to her, "Do not fear,<WH3372> for now<WH1571> <WH2088> you have [another] son.<WH1121>"
And it came<WH1961> about as her soul<WH5315> was departing<WH3318> (for she died<WH4191>), that she named<WH7121> <WH8034> him Ben-oni; but his father called<WH1> him Benjamin.<WH7121>
So Rachel<WH7354> died<WH4191> and was buried<WH6912> on the way<WH1870> to Ephrath<WH672> (that is, Bethlehem<WH1035>).
And Jacob<WH3290> set<WH5324> up a pillar<WH4676> over<WH5921> her grave;<WH6900> that is the pillar<WH4676> of Rachel's grave<WH6900> to this day.<WH3117>
Then Israel<WH3478> journeyed<WH5265> on and pitched<WH5186> his tent<WH168> beyond<WH4480> <WH1973> the tower<WH4029> of Eder.<WH4029>

And it came<WH1961> about while Israel<WH3478> was dwelling<WH7931> in that land,<WH776> that Reuben<WH7205> went<WH1980> and lay<WH7901> with Bilhah<WH1090> his father's concubine;<WH6370> and Israel<WH3478> heard<WH8085> [of it.] Now there were twelve<WH8147> <WH6240> sons<WH1121> of Jacob<WH3290> â€“
the sons<WH1121> of Leah:<WH3812> Reuben,<WH7205> Jacob's first-born, then Simeon<WH8095> and Levi<WH3878> and Judah<WH3063> and Issachar<WH3485> and Zebulun;<WH2074>
the sons<WH1121> of Rachel:<WH7354> Joseph<WH3130> and Benjamin;<WH1144>
and the sons<WH1121> of Bilhah,<WH1090> Rachel's maid:<WH8198> Dan<WH1835> and Naphtali;<WH5321>
and the sons<WH1121> of Zilpah,<WH2153> Leah's maid:<WH8198> Gad<WH1410> and Asher.<WH836> These<WH428> are the sons<WH1121> of Jacob<WH3290> who<WH834> were born<WH3205> to him in Paddan-aram.
And Jacob<WH3290> came<WH935> to his father Isaac<WH1> at Mamre<WH3327> of Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron<WH4471>), where<WH2275> <WH834> Abraham<WH8033> and Isaac<WH85> had sojourned.<WH3327>
Now the days<WH3117> of Isaac<WH3327> were one hundred<WH3967> and eighty<WH8084> years.<WH8141>

And Isaac<WH3327> breathed<WH1478> his last<WH1478> and died,<WH4191> and was gathered<WH622> to his people,<WH9415> an old<WH2205> man<WH2205> of ripe<WH7649> age;<WH3117> and his sons<WH1121> Esau<WH6215> and Jacob<WH3290> buried<WH6912> him.
